message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.ETC. 

The paper discusses the implementation of a PON-based data centre architecture that provides high resilience and high-speed interconnections between servers. This involves the use of switching and routing functionalities within servers using Xilinx NetFPGA. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses the energy efficiency, scalability, and flexibility of the PON technology, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The use of WDM nodes and the PON network for optical connections suggests that it could belong to cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.COMM (Communications and Networking). Finally, the paper could also belong to cs.ETC (Emerging Technologies) as it discusses the use of a relatively new technology (PON) in data centre architecture.
